newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent up sharply as shorts cover on Iraq news.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent up sharply as shorts cover on Iraq news.

text.p: IPE September Brent crude oil spiked up sharply late on Monday after traders were caught short by U.N. approval of an Iraqi aid distribution plan, removing the last obstacle for resumption of crude oil exports by Baghdad.
"Everyone was caught short and its just spiked on the buying," one broker said.
Defying all expectations of a fall the prompt September Brent crude oil contract traded up 36 cents at $19.31 a barrel at 1746 GMT .
The contract easily broke through resistance at $19.10 a barrel, triggering further buy stops, the broker added.
